news.title: Coinbase Partners with U.S. Banks to Pilot Crypto Projects
news.body: Coinbase is making significant strides in bridging traditional banking with the crypto world by partnering with major U.S. banks on stablecoins, custody, and trading initiatives. Announced at the New York Times DealBook Summit by CEO Brian Armstrong, this collaboration could pave the way for broader cryptocurrency adoption in mainstream financial systems, potentially transforming how banks interact with digital currencies.

news.title: Stripe Expands Billing Capabilities with Metronome Acquisition
news.body: Stripe has strategically acquired the usage-billing platform Metronome, enhancing its billing services to offer more dynamic solutions. This move not only broadens Stripe's service portfolio but also strengthens its position in the competitive payments landscape, offering clients more flexible and efficient billing options.

news.title: Cumbuca Opens Brazilian Payments Market to Global Players
news.body: Cumbuca, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is facilitating international companies' entry into Brazil's regulated payments market. By using Cumbuca's license, companies can tap into one of Latin America's largest economies, a move that could significantly impact global payment dynamics and market penetration strategies.

news.title: EU Launches Antitrust Investigation into Meta's AI in WhatsApp
news.body: The European Union is initiating an antitrust probe into Meta's integration of AI in WhatsApp, marking another significant regulatory challenge for Big Tech. This investigation could lead to stricter AI usage regulations, impacting how tech companies deploy AI in communication platforms across Europe.

news.title: Mastercard Enhances Credit Decisioning with New Data Tool
news.body: Mastercard has unveiled a new technology leveraging its vast network and data insights to assist lenders in making smarter, faster credit decisions. This tool aims to revolutionize financial services by enhancing analytical capabilities, thereby improving the efficiency and accuracy of credit assessments.
